name: PivotTableExt
description: Represents a PivotTable report on a worksheet.

properties.name: allowMultipleFilters
properties.description: Sets or retrieves a value that indicates whether a PivotField can have multiple filters applied to it at the same time.

properties.name: alternativeText
properties.description: Returns or sets the descriptive (alternative) text string for the specified PivotTable.

properties.name: columnGrandTotals
properties.description: True┬áif the PivotTable report shows grand totals for columns.

properties.name: compactLayoutColumnHeader
properties.description: Specifies the caption that is displayed in the column header of a PivotTable when in compact row layout form.

properties.name: compactLayoutRowHeader
properties.description: Specifies the caption that is displayed in the row header of a PivotTable when in compact row layout form.

properties.name: compactRowIndent
properties.description: Returns or sets the indent increment for PivotItems when compact row layout form is turned on.

properties.name: dataBodyRange
properties.description: Returns a┬áRange┬áobject that represents the range of values in a PivotTable.

properties.name: dataLabelRange
properties.description: Returns a┬áRange┬áobject that represents the range that contains the labels for the data fields in the PivotTable report.

properties.name: displayContextTooltips
properties.description: Controls whether or not tooltips are displayed for PivotTable cells.

properties.name: displayEmptyColumn
properties.description: Returns┬áTrue┬áwhen the non-empty MDX keyword is included in the query to the OLAP provider for the value axis. The OLAP provider will not return empty columns in the result set. Returns┬áFalse┬áwhen the non-empty keyword is omitted.

properties.name: displayEmptyRow
properties.description: Returns┬áTrue┬áwhen the non-empty MDX keyword is included in the query to the OLAP provider for the category axis. The OLAP provider will not return empty rows in the result set. Returns┬áFalse┬áwhen the non-empty keyword is omitted.

properties.name: displayErrorString
properties.description: True┬áif the PivotTable report displays a custom error string in cells that contain errors. The default value is┬áFalse.

properties.name: displayFieldCaptions
properties.description: Controls whether or not filter buttons and PivotField captions for rows and columns are displayed in the grid.

properties.name: displayNullString
properties.description: True┬áif the PivotTable report displays a custom string in cells that contain null values. The default value is┬áTrue.

properties.name: enableDrilldown
properties.description: True┬áif drilldown is enabled. The default value is┬áTrue.

properties.name: enableFieldDialog
properties.description: True┬áif the┬áPivotTable Field┬ádialog box is available when the user double-clicks the PivotTable field. The default value is┬áTrue.

properties.name: enableFieldList
properties.description: False┬áto disable the ability to display the field list for the PivotTable. If the field list was already being displayed it disappears. The default value is┬áTrue.

properties.name: enableWizard
properties.description: True┬áif the┬áPivotTable Wizard┬áis available. The default value is┬áTrue.

properties.name: errorString
properties.description: Returns or sets a┬áString┬ávalue that represents the string displayed in cells that contain errors when the┬áDisplayErrorString┬áproperty is┬áTrue.

properties.name: fieldListSortAscending
properties.description: Controls the sort order of fields in the PivotTable Field List. When this property is set toTrue, the fields are sorted in ascending order. When it is set to┬áFalse, the fields are sorted in data source order.

properties.name: grandTotalName
properties.description: Returns or sets the text string label that is displayed in the grand total column or row heading in the specified PivotTable report. The default value is the string `Grand Total`.

properties.name: hasAutoFormat
properties.description: True┬áif the PivotTable report is automatically formatted when itΓÇÖs refreshed or when fields are moved.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Checks whether the PivotTable exists at the worksheet level.┬áBoolean.

properties.name: nullString
properties.description: Returns or sets the string displayed in cells that contain null values when theDisplayNullString┬áproperty is┬áTrue. The default value is an empty string.

properties.name: preserveFormatting
properties.description: True┬áif formatting is preserved when the report is refreshed or recalculated by operations such as pivoting, sorting, or changing page field items.For query tables, this property is┬áTrue┬áif any formatting common to the first five rows of data are applied to new rows of data in the query table. Unused cells arenΓÇÖt formatted. The property isFalse┬áif the last AutoFormat applied to the query table is applied to new rows of data. The default value is┬áTrue.

properties.name: printDrillIndicators
properties.description: Specifies whether or not drill indicators are printed with the PivotTable.

properties.name: printTitles
properties.description: True┬áif the print titles for the worksheet are set based on the PivotTable report.┬áFalse┬áif the print titles for the worksheet are used. The default value is┬áFalse.

properties.name: refreshDate
properties.description: Returns the date on which the PivotTable report was last refreshed.

properties.name: refreshName
properties.description: Returns the name of the person who last refreshed the PivotTable report data.

properties.name: repeatItemsOnEachPrintedPage
properties.description: True┬áif row, column, and item labels appear on the first row of each page when the specified PivotTable report is printed.┬áFalse┬áif labels are printed only on the first page. The default value is┬áTrue.

properties.name: rowGrandTotals
properties.description: True┬áif the PivotTable report shows grand totals for rows.

properties.name: saveData
properties.description: True┬áif data for the PivotTable report is saved with the workbook.┬áFalse┬áif only the report definition is saved.

properties.name: showDrillIndicators
properties.description: The┬áShowDrillIndicators┬áproperty is used for toggling the display of drill indicators in the PivotTable.

properties.name: showPageMultipleItemLabel
properties.description: When set to┬áTrue┬á(default), Multiple items will appear in the PivotTable cell on the worksheet whenever items are hidden and an aggregate of non-hidden items is shown in the PivotTable view.

properties.name: showTableStyleColumnHeaders
properties.description: The┬áShowTableStyleColumnHeaders┬áproperty is set to┬áTrue┬áif the coulmn headers should be displayed in the PivotTable.

properties.name: showTableStyleColumnStripes
properties.description: The┬áShowTableStyleColumnStripes┬áproperty displays banded columns in which even columns are formatted differently from odd columns. This makes PivotTables easier to read.

properties.name: showTableStyleLastColumn
properties.description: Returns or sets if the last column is displayed for the specified┬áPivotTable┬áobject.

properties.name: showTableStyleRowHeaders
properties.description: The┬áShowTableStyleRowHeaders┬áproperty is set to┬áTrue┬áif the row headers should be displayed in the PivotTable.

properties.name: showTableStyleRowStripes
properties.description: The┬áShowTableStyleRowStripes┬áproperty displays banded rows in which even rows are formatted differently from odd rows. This makes PivotTables easier to read.

properties.name: showValuesRow
properties.description: Returns or sets whether the values row is displayed.

properties.name: smallGrid
properties.description: True┬áif Microsoft Excel uses a grid thatΓÇÖs two cells wide and two cells deep for a newly created PivotTable report.┬áFalse┬áif Excel uses a blank stencil outline.

properties.name: sortUsingCustomLists
properties.description: The┬áSortUsingCustomLists┬áproperty controls whether custom lists are used for sorting items of fields, both initially when the PivotField is initialized and the PivotItems are ordered by their captions; and later when the user applies a sort.

properties.name: subtotalHiddenPageItems
properties.description: True┬áif hidden page field items in the PivotTable report are included in row and column subtotals, block totals, and grand totals. The default value is┬áFalse.

properties.name: summary
properties.description: Returns or sets the description associated with the alternative text string for the specified PivotTable.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: Returns or sets a string saved with the PivotTable report.

properties.name: totalsAnnotation
properties.description: True┬áif an asterisk (*) is displayed next to each subtotal and grand total value in the specified PivotTable report if the report is based on an OLAP data source. The default value is┬áTrue.

properties.name: vacatedStyle
properties.description: Returns or sets the style applied to cells vacated when the PivotTable report is refreshed. The default value is a null string (no style is applied by default).

properties.name: value
properties.description: Returns or sets a┬áString┬ávalue that represents the name of the PivotTable report.

properties.name: version
properties.description: Returns a┬ávalue that represents the Microsoft Excel version number.

properties.name: calculatedFields
properties.description: Returns a┬áCalculatedFields┬ácollection that represents all the calculated fields in the specified PivotTable report.

properties.name: pivotFields
properties.description: Returns an object that represents either a single PivotTable field (a┬áPivotField┬áobject) or a collection of both the visible and hidden fields (a┬áPivotFields┬áobject) in the PivotTable report.

methods.name: getColumnField
methods.description: Returns an object that represents either a single PivotTable field (a┬áPivotField┬áobject) or a collection of all the fields (a┬áPivotFields┬áobject) that are currently shown as column fields.

parameters.name: Index
parameters.description: Index of the coulmn field to be retrieved.

methods.name: getColumnRange
methods.description: Returns a┬áRange┬áobject that represents the range that contains the column area in the PivotTable report.

methods.name: getDataField
methods.description: Returns an object that represents either a single PivotTable field (a┬áPivotField┬áobject) or a collection of all the fields (a┬áPivotFields┬áobject) that are currently shown as data fields.

methods.name: getHiddenField
methods.description: Returns an object that represents either a single PivotTable field (a┬áPivotField┬áobject) or a collection of all the fields (a┬áPivotFields┬áobject) that are currently not shown as row, column, page, or data fields.

methods.name: getRowField
methods.description: Returns an object that represents either a single field in a PivotTable report (a PivotField┬áobject) or a collection of all the fields (a┬áPivotFields┬áobject) that are currently showing as row fields.

methods.name: getRowRange
methods.description: Returns a┬áRange┬áobject that represents the range including the row area on the PivotTable report.

methods.name: getEntireRange
methods.description: Returns a┬áRange┬áobject that represents the range containing the entire PivotTable report, including page fields.

methods.name: addDataField
methods.description: Adds a data field to a PivotTable report. Returns a┬áPivotField┬áobject that represents the new data field.
methods.signature: addDataField(field: PivotField, caption: string, func: string)

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: The unique field on the server. If the source data is Online Analytical Processing (OLAP), the unique field is a cube field. If the source data is non-OLAP (non-OLAP source data), the unique field is a PivotTable field.

parameters.name: caption
parameters.description: The label used in the PivotTable report to identify this data field.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: The function performed in the added data field.

methods.name: clearTable
methods.description: The┬áClearTable┬ámethod is used for clearing a PivotTable. Clearing PivotTables includes removing all the fields and deleting all filtering and sorting applied to the PivotTables. This method resets the PivotTable to the state it had right after it was created, before any fields were added to it.

methods.name: listFormulas
methods.description: Creates a list of calculated PivotTable items and fields on a separate worksheet.

methods.name: refreshTable
methods.description: Refreshes the PivotTable report from the source data. Returns┬áTrue┬áif itΓÇÖs successful.

parameters.name: seriesBy
parameters.description: Specifies the way columns or rows are used as data series on the chart.
